issue.message: Setting Exact alarms with `setExactAndAllowWhileIdle` requires the `SCHEDULE_EXACT_ALARM` permission or power exemption from user; it is intended for applications where the user knowingly schedules actions to happen at a precise time such as alarms, clocks, calendars, etc. Check out the javadoc on this permission to make sure your use case is valid.
WRITE_EXTERNAL_STORAGE is deprecated (and is not granted) when targeting Android 13+. If you need to write to shared storage, use the `MediaStore.createWriteRequest` intent.

READ_EXTERNAL_STORAGE is deprecated (and is not granted) when targeting Android 13+. If you need to query or interact with MediaStore or media files on the shared storage, you should instead use one or more new storage permissions: `READ_MEDIA_IMAGES`, `READ_MEDIA_VIDEO` or `READ_MEDIA_AUDIO`.
Avoid using `android.media.ExifInterface`; use `androidx.exifinterface.media.ExifInterface` instead
Calling `setType` after setting URI in `Intent` constructor will clear the data: Call `setDataAndType` instead?
Not targeting the latest versions of Android; compatibility modes apply. Consider testing and updating this version. Consult the `android.os.Build.VERSION_CODES` javadoc for details.
Attribute `justificationMode` is only used in API level 26 and higher (current min is 24)
Avoid passing `null` as the view root (needed to resolve layout parameters on the inflated layout's root element)
Consider adding a `<queries>` declaration to your manifest when calling this method; see https://g.co/dev/packagevisibility for details
Redundant label can be removed
Redundant label can be removed
Your app is currently not handling Selected Photos Access introduced in Android 14+
Your app is currently not handling Selected Photos Access introduced in Android 14+

Use `SwitchCompat` from AppCompat or `SwitchMaterial` from Material library

`checkClientTrusted` is empty, which could cause insecure network traffic due to trusting arbitrary TLS/SSL certificates presented by peers
issue.errorLine1: override fun checkClientTrusted(chain: Array<out X509Certificate>?, authType: String?) {}

issue.message: `checkServerTrusted` is empty, which could cause insecure network traffic due to trusting arbitrary TLS/SSL certificates presented by peers
issue.errorLine1: override fun checkServerTrusted(chain: Array<out X509Certificate>?, authType: String?) {}

issue.message: The Network Security Configuration allows the use of user certificates in the release version of your app

Implementing a custom `X509TrustManager` is error-prone and likely to be insecure. It is likely to disable certificate validation altogether, and is non-trivial to implement correctly without calling Android's default implementation.
Insecure Base Configuration

Provide a timeout when requesting a wakelock with `PowerManager.Wakelock.acquire(long timeout)`. This will ensure the OS will cleanup any wakelocks that last longer than you intend, and will save your user's battery.
